titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Baronessa Marii͡a Dmitrievna Vrangel' collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Olga Verhovskoy Dunlop

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-03-13T09:28-0700

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Mariia Dmitrievna Vrangel' Collection)//EN" "reg_140.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, memoirs, biographical material, pamphlets, periodicals, newspapers, photographs, clippings, and printed matter relating to Russian émigré activities following the Russian Revolution and Civil War, including political, military, veterans', religious, educational, cultural, literary, artistic, and social activities. Includes a few papers of M. D. Vrangel'. Also available on microfilm (49 reels). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Microfilm use only (except for magazine and photographs that have not been microfilmed, as noted in container list). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Baronessa Marii͡a Dmitrievna Vrangel' collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1933.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Also available on microfilm (49 reels). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

scopecontent.head: Historical Note
scopecontent.p: This collection was created by Baronessa Marii͡a Vrangel', mother of Baron Petr Nikolaevich Vrangel', last commander of the White Army, as a memorial to the cultural, academic and social contributions of the so-called first Russian emigration. This group was formed by individuals who emigrated from Russia after the defeat of the White Movement in the early 1920s and included many prominent representatives of the cultural and political elite of Imperial Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, memoirs, biographical material, pamphlets, periodicals, newspapers, photographs, clippings, and printed matter relating to Russian émigré activities following the Russian Revolution and Civil War, including political, military, veterans', religious, educational, cultural, literary, artistic, and social activities. Includes a few papers of M. D. Vrangel'.

The collection incorporates a great variety of material, including biographical information which Baronessa Vrangel' solicited from individuals, as well as organizations active in the émigré community, personal correspondence, short biographies and autobiographies, memoirs, original and printed works, as well as photographs. There is also a large volume of clippings from the contemporary émigré press.

The collection consists of two parts: the first is arranged by the profession or field of activity of an individual or organization; this includes writers, artists, and academics, as well as social and professional organizations. The second is arranged by geographical location and includes material about émigré communities scattered around the globe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notebooks listing material contained in the collection "ZHivaia Letopis' Zhivykh." Part I includes alphabetical listings of individuals by profession or field of activity; Part II is organized according to place of residence. Also included are lists of printed matter deposited at the Hoover Institution Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Alphabetical listing of individuals and organizations prominent in Russian émigré cultural and intellectual life from 1917-1933, organized by profession or field of activity, handwritten and copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photograph albums depicting Russian Church abroad, Russian writers, academics and other prominent individuals.

did.unittitle: Album 1. "Russkie Pravoslavnyia TSerkvi za Rubezhom i Dukhovnyia Litsa v Izgnanii". Miscellaneous photographs depicting Russian Orthodox churches abroad and portrait prints of clergy in exile,

Album 2. "Russkie Pisateli, Obshchestvennyia Deiateli i Uchenye v Izgnanii". Includes portrait prints of writers: Prince V. Bariatinskii, N. Berberova, I. Bunin, B. Zaitsev, G. Kuznetsova, M. Osorgin, V. Nabokov, A. Remizov and S. Remizova-Dovgello, Teffi, V. KHodasevich, V. Nemirovich-Danchenko, A. Kuprin, G. Ivanov, N. Odoevtseva and others. Also includes portrait prints of individuals prominent in social organizations and community affairs and Russian academics abroad,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photograph albums depicting artists, musicians and actors.

did.unittitle: Album 3. "Russkie KHudozhniki v Izgnanii, ". Includes portrait prints of A. Benois, F. Brailovskaia, L. Brailovskii, S. Vinogradov, I. Bilibin, D. Stelletskii, R. Verhovskoy, M. Dobuzhinskii, I. Repin, N. Roerich, G. Lukomskii, K. Somov, V. SHukhova, V. SHukhov, N. Globa, Z. Serebriakova, A. IAkovlev, B. Grigoriev (includes informal family snapshots), N. Bogdanov-Bel'skii, A. SHchekhotikhina, S. Tereshkovich, T. Kossinskaia, T. Rodzianko, N. Sofronov, M. Rundal'tsev, K. Beklemisheva; group photographs of Russian artists at "Mir Iskusstva" exhibit in Paris, 1921 and "Obshchestvo Ikona", Paris, undated

Album 4. "Russkie Muzykanty i Artisty Baleta za Rubezhom, 1932". Includes S. Rakhmaninov, I. Stravinskii, N. CHerepnin, N. Metner, A. Ziloti, S. Prokofiev, F. SHaliapin, S. ZHarov, A. Pavlova, B. Nizhinskaia and others,
File 39. Reau, Louis et al., Boris Grigoriev, Faces of Russia, London,

did.unittitle: Album 7. "Kazaki." Lemnos. Includes portrait prints of Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Maj.-Gen. Lobov and Col. P. IAsevich, group photographs of cossacks at work, in training, recreation, embarking on transport ships to Balkans and at work in Bulgaria,

Album 8. "Kazaki v Izgnanii". Includes portrait prints of Gen. A. Kaledin, Gen.-of-Cavalry Krasnov, Gen. A. Filimonov, Gen. A. Bogaevskii, Maj.-Gen. SHil'nikov; "Donskoi Kadetskii Korpus v Serbii"; group photographs of Kuban' and Terek units and miscellaneous other photographs,
Album 8a. "L'Armée Russe au Travail dans les Balkans, "

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photograph albums depicting Russian military abroad.

did.unittitle: Album 9. "Russkaia Armiia v Izgnanii, ". Includes portrait prints of White military leaders, 1921-1932 and miscellaneous photographs depicting "Russkii Velikago Kniazia Konstantina Konstantinovicha Kadetskii Korpus" (Serbia), 1920-1932
Album 10. Same as above. Includes photographs depicting Drozdovtsy and Markovtsy,

Album 11. Same as above. Includes photographs of Russian army units at work in Pernik Mines and other locations in Bulgaria; Russian officers at work in Germany and France (Foreign Legion); miscellaneous photographs depicting officers of Russkie Invalidy za Rubezhom,

did.unittitle: Album 16. "Snimki iz Russkoi ZHizni Prezhnei i Sovremennoi,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes group photographs of the Imperial Family (Alexander III), Russian Military Staff WWI, dedication of Russian memorial church in Bulgaria (King Ferdinand of Bulgaria); Vrangel' family photographs; portrait prints of leaders of White Army in Far East; Don and Kuban Cossacks in exile in Bulgaria; Don Cossacks in France; portrait prints of Russian scientists, academics, doctors, individuals active in community affairs, painters (Larionov and Goncharova in Paris). Miscellaneous prominent individuals (S. Petliura, S. Perovskaia in rare informal snapshot, 1881, informal snapshot of "Anastasia" CHaikovskaia).

dao.title: Album 16. "Snimki iz Russkoi ZHizni Prezhnei i Sovremennoi"
